website_summaries.verdict: A powerful fan for the money, but only works well in small attics.
pros: Makes a big difference in air quality and temperature for a small amount of money
cons: For smaller spaces up to 300 square feet

customer_reviews.title: no problems installing and no vibration like other people were saying in their reviews
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my greenhouse, no problems installing and no vibration like other people were saying in their reviews. If it lasts a few summers is will be well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brands

customer_reviews.title: Great for hot shed.
customer_reviews.text: My shed would get incredibly hot in the summer. Installed this on the highest point of the shed. I put an adjustable temp controlling switch on this that turns the fan on when it reaches 95 degrees. Makes a world of difference. Keeps it at outdoor ambient temperatures instead of oven temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Fan!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in my garage, up high on the back wall at the peak. Hooked it to a light switch on the wall. Decided not to use the thermostat I bought separately as I use it as much for exhaust as to vent heat. Lots of power for a 22' x 22' garage that is open all the way up to the ceiling (lot's of cubic footage to clear). Well worth the price, and just the right size for the wall of my garage. Not too big, not too small. I installed an intake vent at the opposite end to bring in makeup air.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Butler

customer_reviews.title: Seems well built
customer_reviews.text: I use this as an exhaust fan for my shop. It runs sometimes for hours. No issues so far. Motor gets warm when running that long but nothing more then warm. Louvers do their job well. It is not airtight when off though so in winter you will need to figure something out to keep draft out.
customer_reviews.author: Bossman

customer_reviews.title: Quiet fan for equipment enclosure
customer_reviews.text: Really like how the fan works but the installation is not easy due to the really small electrical box at the bottom of the fan frame. The junction box needs to be enlarged to allow 12AWG flex conduit wiring to bend freely i the box. I spent most of my installation time just cutting and bending the wires to fit in the under sized electrical box on the unit. Really quiet fan and really does poll a lot of CFM's through it's 10 inch opening.
customer_reviews.author: skider

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed but needed tune-up.
customer_reviews.text: Read reviews before purchasing. Purchased to rid pool equipment shed of some hot air. Not disappointed as well constructed. Purchased separately and install variable speed and thermostat switches. Concerned about ability for bugs, wasps, etc., getting in so installed range hood filter between fan and housing. As we live near coast, many metals rust, so removed aluminum flappers and painted entire frame. Flappers do move freely, but concerned about hard rain getting in as lot of room between vent flappers and side of frame. Time will tell. See pictures for setup.
customer_reviews.author: KSRoots

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfection
customer_reviews.text: I put in the ten inch fan, single speed behind my wood lathe. It draws the dust from the lathe and also pulls, although slightly, the air from behind me. Because my lathe is in the sunny part of the shop, it's a great help in keeping the temp down. It fits fine between centers. You must be careful when tightening the mounting screws because if you get them to tight, the louvers won't operate. I use this almost every day and so far, so good. I'll update this review should I find a problen in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Fishin Bob

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in a greenhouse I built and it works flawlessly. Louvers open and close easily and it operates very quietly. I had framed the opening with an 1/8 inch of tolerance on the side and top/bottom and fold the screw heads holding the lovers are so large that the fan would not fit into the opening I had framed without modification. Something to pay attention too when planning on the installation of this. I will be purchasing another one of these to help cool my garage in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: kwcarguy

customer_reviews.title: Louvers do not close after fan turned off.
customer_reviews.text: Fan reasonably quiet. Louvers have big gaps on sides. I ended up installing window screen material between fan and metal frame. The biggest issue is that the louvers do not close when fan turned off. I tried light oil on pivot points and confirmed frame not binding after installation to exterior wall. No joy. I also tried one, then two fender washers for extra weight on louvers to assist with closing. Still no joy. Considering I cut a large hole in side of my garden house for the fan, I will have to live with results.
customer_reviews.author: netRanger

customer_reviews.title: Lets in bugs
customer_reviews.text: With the louvers closed, there is 1/4" gap at the ends of all three louvers which lets in bugs and sometimes rain.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent service
customer_reviews.text: Bought to vent my generator shed . Works excellent keeps the hot exhaust out of building pulling in cooler fresh air from outside Well I have been using this little fan and I am very happy with it and will buy another for another project. I highly recommend this little fan .
customer_reviews.author: One Who Shops

customer_reviews.title: Quiet fan, but louvers bind.
customer_reviews.text: Noise level is impressive for the amount of air moved.. Instructions are pretty much non-existent. The integrated louvers were the main reason I chose this fan, and were my main disappointment with it. They moved freely with multiple test fits, but after I finally mounted the frame into the wall studs with lag bolts, they now require manual assistance to move. This tells me there is very little tolerance to allow for slight misalignment in the mounting surface. I've never met a wall that was perfectly square, so in my opinion, this is a major design flaw. Luckily, I had already planned to install an external vent cover with a built-in damper, so the louvers are secondary for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff G.

customer_reviews.title: Expect a lot of challenges with this product
customer_reviews.text: So, how would you match rough opening of 10 1/8" square with 11 3/8" cage diameter? Forget square framing, more elaborate is required to install it securely plus some drilling, forget existing holes.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Yes !! I will buy another and refer to friends ! 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: These are great !! I use them daily in my shop, creates a nice breeze and keeps my shop 1 degree hotter than outside. Before I put these in it would get 20-30 degrees Hotter. There is no insulation in this building. Just remember, it’s not an air conditioner, it’s meant to move air, take hot air out. And it does just that. I put mine on a light switch and a thermostat. I will be putting a couple in my attic in my house. Trying to beat this Arizona Sun/Heat 😁
customer_reviews.author: Jay11

customer_reviews.title: SOLD SEPARATELY DECEPTION
customer_reviews.text: These vendors have a photo showing all the required plugs and temperature controllers but in very light gray contrast shows 'sold separately'. This is clearly deceptive.
customer_reviews.author: Sarge K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Installed in Garage/ smoking room. Works very well and relatively quiet. No obnoxious hum.. Used with KBWC-16K (H9001) Wall Mount AC Fan Motor Control and the speed goes down to whisper {after adjusting the lower limit} If I were installing in commercial space I might spend more but then again, might not if I only had to replace it every couple of years
customer_reviews.author: Jim A

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: My contractor and his guys were so impressed with this they wanted to order it for themselves. Installed it as a bathroom exhaust fan. It is surprisingly powerful yet runs smoothly and pretty quietly. A great deal price wise too.
customer_reviews.author: C. Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: A Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality fan, made of metal, not plastic, and it does not have that 'made in China' feel to it. (Looks good now; check back tomorrow because it won't be working) It is very quiet. Being used as a cooling fan on a generator shack. The louvers close well after the fan shuts down, preventing the backflow of air.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Works fine....but...
customer_reviews.text: As someone else mentioned I wish the flaps will close a bit tighter. The easy to install is not really directly to the fan, as these things are never easy to install. I had to take it apart to leave the flaps outisde and the fan inside. But it worked out fine. It is a good product and hopefully will last a few years.
customer_reviews.author: GoodCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great little vent fan!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice fan for the price. I installed it in the wall of my compressor closet as a means of maintaining cool air flow even with the door closed. It really cuts down on the noise as I used to have to leave the door open for air flow. Easy to install and nicely made. It works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Trina

customer_reviews.title: Performance, quality, easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Well built and easy to install vent fan. I used it on a shed that has poor ventilation and is very hot in the FL summer. I was having mold issues and needed to supplement the 8x13 louvered vents. I wired it to a temperature control switch that turns it on when it’s above 90 and off at 80. Does a great job! I plan on getting a larger one for my workshop!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Quiet fan, well built, however with one issue...
customer_reviews.text: The fan runs quiet and throws a lot of air. Also, it is well built. The only concern is that the flaps do not fully close after shutting off the fan. I will need to put in some effort to ensure they close fully to stop heat loss through the vent flaps.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly how you’ve pictured it
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works exactly as it should. Pick you up a vari speed fan control so it doesn’t just fire full blast. I use mine as an exhaust fan in my single stall garage. Just beware, when installing it cannot be in a bind. The metal will bend and force the louvers shut.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: Good quality exhaust fan.
customer_reviews.text: Fan worked fine as a basement exhaust fan. I removed one of the two basement window panes from those small windows that tilt in and replaced it with a wood frame for the fan. Seems to be a solid product and has a good air-flow without being overly noisy. The louvers work nicely at keeping wind and rain out.
customer_reviews.author: JohnLobban

customer_reviews.title: Seems to move a lot of Air
customer_reviews.text: Have two security camera systems installed in an uninsulated 12 X 16 Wood Building. Keeps the equipment a lot cooler than no fan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed. (10” variable)
customer_reviews.text: Used this to vent my generator house. Finally got a good test last night as the power went out for an hour. Sorry for the dark picture, I finished the project at night. Vents function smoothly and fan drafts very well. Very quiet as well.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice design and works very well. I would recommend this unit
customer_reviews.text: Best way to remove hot air from my laundry room. After years of sticking a box fan in an open window, it never really was able to get the hot air out. This fan does remove all the hot air and replaces it with cooler outside air through the same window that used to have the ugly box fan. The fan is not real quiet, but I don't live in the laundry room. And this little 900 CFM fan moves a lot of air. The outside shutters should be able to to keep out most all bugs. I would recommend this unit to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Good size not too loud. Wish it had mounting hardware.
customer_reviews.text: The fan comes packaged well but doesn’t come with any type of mounting hardware. Luckily I had some bolts and nuts at home. So be prepared to grab something before installing. It’s very easy to setup. I added a thermostat to my system and couldn’t be happier. The garage is much cooler now!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Silva

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly. Worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived very quickly. It works as advertised. I installed it with the speed controller recommended in the advertisement. It all works well. The fan is fairly quiet compared to other exhaust fans I have heard. I installed it at the highest point in my enclosed patio to help with ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it's money
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly. I can only estimate it moves the amount of air as stated but works fairly quitely. I installed mine in a emergency generator house and I'm totally happy with it's quality. It could be a bit more rain resistant as the sheet metal housing has open seams.
customer_reviews.author: T Bird

customer_reviews.title: Quite, smooth running & not too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this unit to cool my two car garage. We live in Pheonix, so anything you can do to vent hot air out is a good thing. For a relatively small unit it moves quite a lot of air & is very quiet. If you want a small, well made exhaust fan for not a great deal of money..... this is it PS If you add a thermostat to the purchase, it will only activate the fan when it’s hot out..... that’s the ticket !
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Malky

customer_reviews.title: used in a small barn to air it out and ...
customer_reviews.text: used in a small barn to air it out and ordered the thermostat so it would come on at a set temperature. also wired it to a switch to manually turn on
customer_reviews.author: R. Kern

customer_reviews.title: A DIY Struggle
customer_reviews.text: The hardwire box is SO. SMALL. It clearly is not intended for adult male Anglo hands, if you catch my drift. Also, fan motor gets extremely hot when running...which is a concern. The seller should work on clarifying to the consumer what is what, what model needs what equipment for installation, and simplifying their product page (which is a total mess).
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great exhaust fan work very well
customer_reviews.text: Very good and work great exhaust fan for an outside kitchen area or wherever you need to have an exhaust fan. The price is great can't beat it but I would recommend it if you need an exhaust fan. Not to hard to install. Just take little time.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Motor dird first day in temps above 100
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately not made for High heat, as it killed it. My problem it is built around a shed now. So i returned fan, we shall see what happen. I ended up buying a forced air vent fan for heat. Not as powerful, but doinging something..
customer_reviews.author: Lee OnAWhim

customer_reviews.title: Good quality fan, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in a 12x20 outbuilding. It was easy to install and works great. It moves alot of air for its small size. Definitely would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Bigdog79

customer_reviews.title: No problems - very well built - Fits well.
customer_reviews.text: The only question at this point is the lifespan of the motor, however, if it is made anything like the rest of the fan - this should be good for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: MAB

customer_reviews.title: Runs very smooth.
customer_reviews.text: Fan runs very smooth. the louvers would stick sleep slightly open. I found the case was slightly bent by the louvers and had applied just slight pressure not enough to stop it opening but enough to stop it from closing. With just a little adjustment they close properly.
customer_reviews.author: Eurotrash

customer_reviews.title: Never got the chance to use them
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased two of these for my vegetable green house I was building at my new house. Unfortunately I never got the chance to install them before my house burned down in the recent bear fire. Both were left behind.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Willin

customer_reviews.title: As advertised,
customer_reviews.text: nice unit, thanks for the previous reviews I made sure the unit was installed perfectly squared. Recommend squaring unit good for no problems. moves air good.
customer_reviews.author: prod review

customer_reviews.title: Bought for generator box
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my generator box. I wired a extension cord to the fan and plugged it into the generator. This fan pulls the hot air out so well the sides of the box dont even get warm with the generator running.
customer_reviews.author: Chad_Hollywood

customer_reviews.title: Helps cool my garage
customer_reviews.text: I have a steel 24x25 garage that can get too warm to work in during the Summer. I installed this near the peak along with a thermostat control. Hasn't been a day since that I couldn't work in there.
customer_reviews.author: American

customer_reviews.title: Efficiency
customer_reviews.text: Comparatively small size - easy installation, impressive volume of musty air turns a wet basement into almost livable space.
customer_reviews.author: boris

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for a low price.
customer_reviews.text: The fan wotks great not impressed with the therostat but the fan was a great buy. It helps cool my RV storage area and I hope it will help with the moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Mosteller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fan.
customer_reviews.text: This fan is an awesome buy. I installed it in a 12x12 shed and it works wonders. I’m in Houston TX and the heat here is brutal. I will be purchasing thermostat module.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Moves some air!
customer_reviews.text: We have a food trailer and it gets very hot. Ordered one of these and it worked so well I ordered a 2nd. Works well at pulling air out efficiently. Used the 10in Model
customer_reviews.author: Danny Rogers Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great Fan for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Wanted an exhaust fan for a storage building, this worked perfect, although had to shield it from rain blowing past the louvers.
customer_reviews.author: RetiredRR

customer_reviews.title: environmental control add on died after a week, fan died about a week later
customer_reviews.text: Light use, 3-4 hours a day killed this fan, entirely. I heavily recommend you look elsewhere for equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fan I give 3 stars because I bought for a bathroom and its a bit noisy and does not seal when
customer_reviews.text: Great fan I give 3 stars because I bought for a bathroom and its a bit noisy and does not seal when the fan is turned off. I wound up installing a screen to keep bugs out.
customer_reviews.author: South Florida Technical Training

customer_reviews.title: very good little fan
customer_reviews.text: Keeping the temperature down in my shop. Not very noisy, very little vibration. Comes with no wiring, but easy to connect to 3 conductor wire. Connected mine to thermal switch for auto off and on as needed. Fantastic for the price.
customer_reviews.author: KAREN PAYNE

customer_reviews.title: Cools the garage!
customer_reviews.text: Relatively low cost. Easy to install. Not too noisy. Only complaint I have is the louvers not sealing well when closed. I installed a magnet so they pull closed when the fan stops running.
customer_reviews.author: K2

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive for basic equipment, but well-made. Runs well. No need for controller if you just want an exhaust fan; this does the job (in my 8'x16' greenhouse).
customer_reviews.author: T. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 6x8 greenhouse
customer_reviews.text: Works well for harbor freight 6x8 greenhouse. Replaced the back wall center panel (opposite the door) with plywood to mount the fan into. Added 3 French drain pipes under the walls to allow air from outside to circulate into the greenhouse when the fan cuts on. Plugged the fan into a thermostat switch so it comes on when the interior temperature exceeds 80 degrees, and cuts off once it cools back down to 80 degrees. Slightly noisy but no more than is expected with a high velocity fan.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small exhaust fan
customer_reviews.text: I installed a 10 in. Unit to power vent the garage.... perfect I would not recommend any roof like installation .5
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful good investment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan to remove smoke from the kitchen while cooking. It's doing everything I could have hoped for. We use cast iron skillets allot which can get Smokey fast. But while running this little fan it completely keeps the smoke removed. My wife keeps telling me just how much she loves it. I would recommend getting a variable speed control for it. JG
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: A must have in a shop/garage
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and hook up. This exhaust fan really helps the air circulation and I’m very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bama Girl

customer_reviews.title: 6X8 Green house
customer_reviews.text: I got this to cool a 6x8 green house and it worked great the green house got to 120 and it was 100 outside this fan took it down to a nice 99
customer_reviews.author: Kevsac916

customer_reviews.title: exhaust fan
customer_reviews.text: it's ok.... wish it wouldn't blow open witht the wind. it works
customer_reviews.author: Debra Perks

customer_reviews.title: Chicken Coop vent
customer_reviews.text: I use this to vent my chicken coop. It runs 24 hours a day is quiet and works well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Works good... is part of my plastic horizontal shed project. To move air in and heat out.
customer_reviews.author: Fyrcapn

customer_reviews.title: Easy install works like it should but I guess I ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy install works like it should but I guess I was hoping it would move more air,mnow I know bigger size will move more CFL
customer_reviews.author: rliv

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, perfect price
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small fan to vent my shipping container. This one was the perfect size. Complete with automatic louver. Was easy to install. All that's left is wiring it. I will update review in future weeks it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Kidd

customer_reviews.title: Good for you the money
customer_reviews.text: It was a weird way they tell you to install it,mounting the flange on the inside then adding molding around the fan on the outside
customer_reviews.author: Skasp

customer_reviews.title: As described, OSHA compliant.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing negative to post. From ordering, shipment, packaging, and installations... There was never an issue in the quality of the product or integrity of the seller. Bought for an attic exhaust controlled by a fire-stat thermostat, the product has ran all summer efficiently without showing signs of wear and continues to maintain near silence when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Felegie Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: Good fan for a10' by 10' shed
customer_reviews.text: easy to install, quiet but the shutters do not open and close all the way. Purchased the remote for temp and humidity works greats
customer_reviews.author: pepper1895

customer_reviews.title: It does a great job
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and moves hot air out of attic.
customer_reviews.author: SusyQ

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Just what we wanted, easy to install, vents room great..
customer_reviews.author: Barry S Crawford

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: This fan runs fine but the shutter assembly is pure junk. Stopped working within the first two weeks. Lubrication didn't help. Now I have to manually open and close the shutter every time I turn the fan on or off.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great exhaust system.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and expect to get many years of service.
customer_reviews.author: D. Arredondo

customer_reviews.title: Produce is as advertised, and then some.  Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Produce is as advertised, and then some. Very satisfied. Unhappy with having to mark a star in temperature control, when in fact, it is totally NA>
customer_reviews.author: Connie Fame Dotson

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with a vari-speed control. It’s a bit louder than I thought it would be. The hum is not from vibration, but just motor noise. A little tricky to mount it and not affect the opening and closing of the vents if it’s not perfectly square when mounting. I eventually got it opening/closing nice and easy with a few shims and making sure the screws aren’t too tight or too loose.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S.

customer_reviews.title: Small, simple, well made
customer_reviews.text: FAST delivery, I think they were knocking as I clicked "ORDER". Well made, fairly heavy metal, shaded pole motor so no worries about overheating. Unblievable price
customer_reviews.author: lewweingarth

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My home has no attic and has high cathedral ceilings. Decided to install one in the upper windows and so far it works quite wall. Not the most quiet fan but it takes the hot air out of the house.
customer_reviews.author: APC Houston

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Item is great. Ease of install would depend on application but these worked like a charm for our shipping storage containers.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: works fine
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect in my boiler room to vent heat. Tied it to a firestat thermostat. Not very loud at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It has helped draw out hot air from our storage building tremendously!
customer_reviews.author: valerie

customer_reviews.title: perfect for chicken coop
customer_reviews.text: My chickens love it - they roost near the draft it creates. Easy to install. We Attached to a temperature monitoring switch.
customer_reviews.author: Shebrew

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. Seems solid and well built. Now time will tell. Oh, not to loud. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Sharon M. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: good price for a good product.
customer_reviews.text: works great! Not loud at all. I used it for a crawlspace vent. If the room is totally quiet then you can just barely hear it. The room is right above the fan too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The louvers are a little questionable.
customer_reviews.text: I like the quietness of the fan, and how much air it draws. But the louvers have trouble closing at times. I don't know if some WD-40 or something would help it. It was mounted squarely and never dropped. Otherwise it's doing the job
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Stenger

customer_reviews.title: Works Good
customer_reviews.text: Fan is the perfect size to ventilate my 20' storage container. No problems with fan yet.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Fan
customer_reviews.text: Simple to hardwire.......purchased for my 8x8 greenhouse dwc hydro setup.....works well and moves slot of air.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: effective temp control
customer_reviews.text: reduces indoor temperature by about 3 degrees within about 45min during the hottest time of the day. this measurement is taken inside a 10x14 wooden shed with no shade.
customer_reviews.author: Snow

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for smaller spaces
customer_reviews.text: Was delivered promptly, easy to install. Ideal for smaller areas. Will be installing it this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great exhaust fan for my garage!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Installed this in the gable of my 18X21 metal garage, works very well. Ivan definitely tell a difference in the temperature now. Ordered this with the recommended thermostat and both perform very well!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffry Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and powerful
customer_reviews.text: We has an electrician install this fan. It is so quiet and powerful. It's perfect for my husband's 12x16 shop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Used it to vent my inclosed patio. No more smoke issues!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This fan works perfect
customer_reviews.text: We have used this fan for a full year and it works perfect still.
customer_reviews.author: onlineshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great, but  no controls - you have to buy them separately.
customer_reviews.text: Great fan. Only one is negative - the are no controls - you have to buy them separately.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria de Gaulle

customer_reviews.title: Solid made
customer_reviews.text: First day using this fan hooked up to aptmartment building in NYC and so far I’m very impressed. No electrical hardware. Luckily had an old lamp with a switch laying around so I cut that off and hooked it up to the fan. So far so good. Not as loud as I anticipated. Will update on the durability later.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Hades

customer_reviews.title: Good fan
customer_reviews.text: Worked. Install was moderate. Fit between 16" add studs. Used recommended thermostat. Works good so far.
customer_reviews.author: storhund

customer_reviews.title: ... $7 timer from Walmart - and my greenhouse stays cool!
customer_reviews.text: attached to a $7 timer from Walmart - and my greenhouse stays cool!
customer_reviews.author: CJ Farley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good price ... works great as a ventilator for my generator shed, just plug into generator for power
customer_reviews.author: CNYSarge

customer_reviews.title: Incredible fan of this product.
customer_reviews.text: The fan works well and is very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Name

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome fan. Naught for a shipping container 40' as my shop and it keeps the air flow flowing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Stowers

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought to vent my garage from fuse and smoke instead of putting in a ceiling exhaust fan. Simply cut a hole in my Exterior door and installed. Great power and overall good design.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly E. Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Got it to exhaust smoke from garage during card games and partys. Works great. Does the job. Fyi purchase a fan speed control switch for install. Then you can control speed.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Barto

customer_reviews.title: This was exactly what we needed for our enclosed grilling ...
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what we needed for our enclosed grilling area. We put a dimmer switch on it to control speed.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon W.

customer_reviews.title: This fan is great would buy another
customer_reviews.text: This fan keeps my green house cool enough for my weed plants to not over heat in 100 plus degrees and I have no other fans going if u r looking for a good fan to get rid of heat or smell this is it would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kevin s.

customer_reviews.title: Be sure you get the correct size fan for your greenhouse.
customer_reviews.text: The fan works quite well for my greenhouse I have no problems or complaints with this fan.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Lockhart

product_meta.title: iLIVING - 10" Wall Mounted Exhaust Fan, Silver (ILG8SF10V)
product_meta.description: Style:Fan OnlyiLiving - Wall Mounted Shutter Exhaust Fan Are you looking for a reliable way to reduce your cooling costs while keeping your home cooler and more comfortable year-round? If so, you’ve found just what you’re looking for! Made with top quality materials, craftsmanship and engineering, the iLiving Shutter Exhaust Fan is designed to offer superior ventilation in any space you choose to install. By removing excess heat and moisture our exhaust fan prevents mold and allergens to keep your living space cooler and more comfortable year-round while reducing expensive cooling bills. Heavy-Duty, Galvanized Steel Frame Weather Resistant Aluminum Shutters and Blades Motion-Balanced for Quiet Operation Thermally Protected and Permanently Lubricated Motor Automatic Shutters For Home Cooling and Ventilation Corrosion-Resistant Wire Guards Variable Speed Setting Functionality On Select Sizes (controller sold separately) UL Listed Available in (8 or 9) Size Variations Perfect Cooling and Ventilation Solution For Homes Attics Garages Sheds Removing Excess Heat and Moisture Preventing Allergens and Mold Reducing Cooling Costs And More iLiving - Wall Mounted Shutter Exhaust Fan Are you looking for a reliable way to reduce your cooling costs while keeping your home cooler and more comfortable year-round? If so, you’ve found just what you’re looking for! Made with top quality materials, craftsmanship and engineering, the iLiving Shutter Exhaust Fan is designed to offer superior ventilation in any space you choose to install. By removing excess heat and moisture our exhaust fan prevents mold and allergens to keep your living space cooler and more comfortable year-round while reducing expensive cooling bills. Heavy-Duty, Galvanized Steel Frame Weather Resistant Aluminum Shutters and Blades Motion-Balanced for Quiet Operation Thermally Protected and Permanently Lubricated Motor Automatic Shutters For Home Cooling and Ventilation Corrosion-Resistant Wire Guards Variable Speed Setting Functionality On Select Sizes (controller sold separately) UL Listed Available in (8 or 9) Size Variations Perfect Cooling and Ventilation Solution For Homes Attics Garages Sheds Removing Excess Heat and Moisture Preventing Allergens and Mold Reducing Cooling Costs And More The fan comes fully assembled out of the box; only installation required is the electrical hardwiring. The shutter fan comes in 8 different sizes: 10 inches, 12 inches, 16 inches, 18 inches, 20 inches, 24 inches, 30 inches, and 36 inches. The 18-inch shutter fan has both a variable Speed ILG8SF24V and a Single Speed model. The iLIVING 30-inch and 36-inch shutter fans are only available in single Speed. For variable-speed models, the iLIVING ILG8SFSC Speed controller is sold separately.
feature_bullets: CUT COOLING COSTS: Reduce expensive cooling bills at home. Ready to install, our wall mount automatic shutter vent fan is designed to help remove excess heat and moisture, prevent mold and allergens to keep your living space cooler and more comfortable year-round.

MULTIPURPOSE: Perfect cooling and ventilation solution for any space at your home - including the attic, garage, shed, and more. Corrosion-resistant, the fully enclosed motor is thermally protected and permanently lubricated for easy maintenance.
VARIABLE SPEED: Customize your comfort. iLiving Exhaust Fan has adjustable speed functionality when combined with the iLIVINGILG8SFSC speed controller (sold separately).

WEATHER RESISTANT SHUTTERS: Constructed from durable, high-grade aluminum, these shutters can withstand moisture and heatlonger than other competitors’ products adding to the fan’s longevity and preventing corrosive rust from forming.

POWERFUL AND EFFICIENT: Small but mighty, you’ll enjoy the power and efficiency of iLiving’s Shutter Exhaust Fan. The 10-inch runs onstandard 120 volts at 1/25 HP, 0. 55 amps with 1580 rotations per minute, cooling and ventilating an area of 600 cubic feet per minute!
